Election.definition: the act or process of electing b

1 a.definition: the act or process of electing

sub_terms.b: an instance of the electorate voting for candidates for an elective office

2.definition: the right, power, or privilege of making a choice

sub_terms.a: the right of a spouse to choose a statutorily prescribed amount of a deceased spouse's estate or whatever was devised to him or her under the will
sub_terms.b: the right of a person who has an interest in property that a deceased has disposed of by will either to claim his or her right to the property or to accept what he or she was devised under the will instead
sub_terms.c: the right of a party to a contract that has been breached by the other party to choose to continue or terminate the contract see also,
